title: Low FPS in battles with 2017 MacBook Pro
body:
So, ever since I bought a new 2017 MacBook Pro I've experienced pretty crappy FPS. It's fine when I start a match it can hit 100+ FPS, but as soon as I get into a fight with other players my frame rate drops drastically to like 15FPS. This is strange as I didn't run into this problem with my previous iMacs I owned (from 2011). I've even tried setting the graphics settings to Low and it makes no difference. The settings seem to produce the exact same results. Here are my system specs:

Processor Name:	Intel Core i7
Processor Speed:	2.9 GHz

Total Number of Cores:	4
L2 Cache (per Core):	256 KB
L3 Cache:	8 MB
Memory:	16 GB

**Radeon Pro 560:**

  Bus:	PCIe

  VRAM (Total):	4096 MB

**Displays:**

  Online:	Yes

  Automatically Adjust Brightness:	Yes
  Connection Type:	DisplayPort

ASUS PB287Q:
  Resolution:	3840 x 2160 @ 30 Hz

  Online:	Yes
  Rotation:	Supported
  Automatically Adjust Brightness:	No

I also have a really fast connection with no problem with my ping. Any idea what is going on? Again, I didn't have this problem with my old computer from 2011.

replies.body: I am having the same exact issue with my Macbook Pro Late 2016 15inch. Was there ever a resolution to this? I have seen countless other posts with teh same exact issue and no resolution.

I'm experiencing the _exact_ same problem with my 2017 Macbook Pro. 

Matches begin well above 100 FPS, but as soon as anything graphically demanding occurs on my screen (teamfight, camera movement, even a flashy-looking ability), my FPS drops significantly for the rest of the game. From there it's totally unstable - sometimes it's at a decent 50, other times it's at an unplayable 3. Even when I tab out, my whole desktop goes laggy until I close the game. I attempted the same fixes as OP, but to no avail.

Here's a couple other problems I noticed: 

* When I try to quit a match from the in-game menu (or even when I press CMD+Q), the game freezes. It also freezes when I close the menu after making adjustments to my audio settings. 

* No in-game sounds while using a wireless Bluetooth headset. Are game sounds supposed to transmit over Bluetooth? I can hear everything else, even the client. It probably would have been a good idea to try the built-in speakers. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

League looks absolutely gorgeous on this computer. Unfortunately, there's no way to play around these bugs. I hope a fix comes out soon.

Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) just in case this could actually be packet loss during intense moments like team fights.  Otherwise, this could also be happening for other reasons like bad game assets.  The steps in the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide should help!
Thanks, I'll try that next time I play and report back. :)

So just played a gain with really crappy FPS during team fights and ran the log reader on it. Average ping was 40ms and max ping was 45ms with minimal packet loss. I had disabled auto graphics switching, disabled the sound, and ran on medium settings. Still awful FPS. I'll try repairing the game files and a few other things, but I'm feeling like there's something else going on here. :-(

Thanks for the follow up!  Was the packet loss in the clear too?  If the guide wasn't able to help, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can work with you directly.

Download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well for some logs, and attach it to your ticket.  We'll reply back as soon as we can.  :D

So just to follow up with this, the thing that actually helped was I turned on v-sync. Now I get a pretty stable 50FPS. I was hoping it would be higher, but 50FPS is fine. :)
